headline.main: Thursday Reading: New School Meal Rules Aim to Cut Obestity

docs.abstract: New school meal rules aim to cut obesity, TiqIQ is the Kayak of live-event tickets, defend your phone against hackers and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

headline.main: He Has Two Legs. But What About His Name?

docs.abstract: City Room is looking for the man whose intact leg was Photoshopped out of a city anti-obesity ad to make it look as if he'd lost it to diabetes.
docs.snippet: City Room is looking for the man whose intact leg was Photoshopped out of a city anti-obesity ad to make it look as if he'd lost it to diabetes.

headline.main: He Has Two Legs. But What About His Name?

docs.abstract: City Room is looking for the man whose intact leg was Photoshopped out of a city anti-obesity ad to make it look as if he'd lost it to diabetes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Update, Jan. 29 | We found him, or, more accurately, he responded to us. He's an actor named Cleo Berry who is not thrilled with the fictionalization of his body. Read the story.
docs.snippet: City Room is looking for the man whose intact leg was Photoshopped out of a city anti-obesity ad to make it look as if he'd lost it to diabetes.

headline.seo: Brown Fat Burns Ordinary Fat, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Brown Fat, Triggered by Cold or Exercise, May Yield a Key to Weight Control
headline.main: Brown Fat, Triggered by Cold or Exercise, May Yield a Key to Weight Control

docs.abstract: Researchers in separate studies have determined that in cold conditions, people’s calorie-gobbling brown fat uses ordinary fat as fuel, and that exercise may convert ordinary fat to brown fat.
docs.lead_paragraph: In separate studies, researchers have determined that in cold conditions, people’s calorie-gobbling brown fat uses ordinary fat as fuel — and that exercise may convert ordinary fat to brown fat.
docs.snippet: In separate studies, researchers have determined that in cold conditions, people’s calorie-gobbling brown fat uses ordinary fat as fuel — and that exercise may convert ordinary fat to brown fat.

headline.seo: Study Finds No Childhood Obesity Link to School Junk Food
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: No Obesity Link to Junk Food in Schools
headline.main: Nutrition: No Obesity Link to Junk Food in Schools

docs.abstract: Study by Jennifer Van Hook published in journal Sociology of Education finds no correlation at all between obesity and attending a school where sweets and salty snacks are available, suggesting that efforts to ban the sale of junk food in schools may not be effective.
docs.lead_paragraph: No matter how researchers looked at data, they could not uncover a correlation between childhood obesity and the sale of sweets and salty snacks in public schools.
docs.snippet: No matter how researchers looked at data, they could not uncover a correlation between childhood obesity and the sale of sweets and salty snacks in public schools.

headline.main: Really? The Claim: Excess Weight Raises the Risk of Acne

docs.abstract: Researchers have found, once again, that weight gain and moderate to severe acne go hand in hand, particularly among young women.
docs.snippet: Researchers have found, once again, that weight gain and moderate to severe acne go hand in hand, particularly among young women.

docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column asserts that food celebrity Paula Deen's announcement about having diabetes underscores how chefs and food celebrities often lead much more restrained lives and have more healthful diets than their public images would seem to suggest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lessons from Paula Deen on indulgence and its consequences.
docs.snippet: Lessons from Paula Deen on indulgence and its consequences.
